com.yantra.api.omp.pricing

Interface computePriceForItem

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.OMPApi, YIFApi
    Deprecated. 
    Replaced by getItemPrice API as of Sterling Selling and Fulfillment Suite 8.5.

    public interface computePriceForItem

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Deprecated Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document computePriceForItem(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)

      The computePriceForItem API computes the Region Specific Price for an item on a given date.

    • Method Detail

      • computePriceForItem

        org.w3c.dom.Document computePriceForItem(YFSEnvironment env,
                                         org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                  throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                         java.rmi.RemoteException
        Deprecated. 

        The computePriceForItem API computes the Region Specific Price for an item on a given date.


          General Logic:
            1. For a given price program and pricing date, obtain all price sets. If a price set record is not found, the ListPrice, UnitPrice, and RetailPrice are defaulted to zero and the PriceSet element of the output document is not returned.
            2. Obtain a list of regions for the organization and item group code that can serve the given address (for more information on how this list is obtained, please see the getRegionList API javadoc).
            3. From the list of regions, obtain the corresponding records from item price set details.
            4. From the price set list obtained in step 1, the item price set records obtained in step 3, and for the given item Id obtain all the item price set records.
            5. After sorting the price set list by PriceSetKey, RegionPriority (with ' ' as the lowest priority and the lowest level region as the highest priority), and breakQtyLow, for each Price Set -> for the most granular region -> pick the unit price from the highest break quantity low and set it to the new list for further selection across price sets.
            6. From the new list, select the price set that has the latest StartDate. If there are multiple price sets with the same StartDate, then the lowest unit price is used as a tie breaker.

          Example:
            From the records below:

            Price set key Region key BreakQtyLow Unit Price
            1111 2222 20 10
            1111 2222 40 8
            1112 3333 50 7
            1112 3333 60 6

            the following are selected:

            Price set key Region key BreakQtyLow Unit Price
            1111 2222 40 8
            1112 3333 60 6

            Now, select the price set that belongs to the price program definition with the latest StartDate. If there are multiple price sets with the same StartDate, choose the lowest Unit Price.

        Note: QryType is not supported for the PersonInfo element

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits: None

        Events Raised: None

        Audits: None

        Pre-conditions: None

        Post-conditions: None

        Output Template Support: Yes

          Template Name: computePriceForItem.xml
          If the output template does not exist or is not passed:
          Error: YFS10379 - Template not found

        Database Extensibility Support: Yes

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        An XML document that contains the Region Specific Price for an item on a given date. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.

        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
